g.text: this is the default page; links to all major areas
landing page for introductory content and general overview
this contains linked or specific content for new members/people and gives step-by-step instructions
a short high-level overview over ASAM and how members participate etc.
a short overview over all major processes + links to their full definition
a short overview over all typical roles at ASAM and a link to the roles landing page
summarizes the standard tools used at and supported by ASAM in their projects and notes that there are more - see roles
overview over what projects there are and links (?) to them
this should explain how this guide works
describes what this guide does and doesn't do and gives an overview over its general structure
tips and information on navigating and using this guide, e.g. search feature etc.
this only gives a brief summary and links to the detailed section
contains information on how to get involved in ASAM projects
Active Project: Join As Work Group Member
this page contains the role definitions and links to role definitions
one for each role; each follows the same basic structure and contains a summary of the role
contains all important processes used by ASAM and in their projects
this contains all definitions in their original file. pages may include (parts) of them where needed, e.g. for roles and tutorials
TBD: Join with ASAM Project Handbook?
all processes and workflows go here, either linked automatically or manually (TBD)
all definitions, wording etc. go here, linked automatically
contains a list of typical abbreviations, ideally can be reused in projects etc.
contains all information in full on tools
each tool has its own main page and the same basic architecture, with some alterations
this contains tutorials, definitions, and guidelines for working on this specification
Page without entry in navigation bar
